nodes.bodyText:
I think instead of a subscribe delay this should be a subscribe timeout. Subscribe delay is a slow and brittle approach that always waits that amount of time before subscribing. Brittle because if it's not an appropriate value for that environment it will fail.
A subscribe timeout is a smarter approach that would retry subscribe every 1s up to the timeout when a topic not found is returned, potentially returning quicker than the delay. This may have been what Appy was getting at.
I understand you have message timeout, but that should probably be adjusted to start after subscription is successful.

Yeah, Appy and I agreed on this. I was hoping to do retry in a different PR within the spring but wanted to get this in and focus on a few other things earlier on.
Let me know if this is blocking or if I can address this later as it works for now.
I'm okay to go with this approach and replace it with subscribeTimeout in a follow up.
Went ahead and implemented retry logic
These timeouts/delays should be a Duration
Fixed and removed one
Why are we duplicately storing these instead of just storing the AcceptanceTestProperties?
I should store the object over the individual primitives. Will fix.
removed

Updated .feature files to specify an expectedCount of messages which can differ from the published amount. This allows for environments where transaction volume is small and files aren't closed as often.

As a non-programmer, I should be able to read these feature files and understand them. These changes makes it non-obvious and confusing. A better approach would be to revert to the old feature file with a single numMessages, then publish numMessages and every second after publish one more message until timeout. The additional messages are just for closing the record file and can be ignored and you just verify you received at least numMessages.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -5,23 +5,23 @@ Feature: HCS Base Coverage Feature
     Scenario Outline: Validate Topic message submission
         Given I successfully create a new topic id
         And I publish and verify <numMessages> messages sent
-        When I provide a number of messages <numMessages> I want to receive
+        When I provide a number of messages <expectedCount> I want to receive
         And I subscribe with a filter to retrieve messages
         Then the network should successfully observe these messages
         Examples:
-            | numMessages |
-            | 100         |
+            | numMessages | expectedCount |
+            | 15          | 10            |

nodes.bodyText: This will retry all StatusRuntimeException, not just NOT_FOUND. You probably want to set exceptionExpression to interrogate the code.
Will look into this
This is now unused, right? Though we do need some sort of limit to subscribe: either subscribeTimeout or subscribeRetries?

nodes.bodyText: Default should be in code. Can remove default in config or duplicate it.
Will set.
Why are we retrying create topics? They could've potentially failed for valid reasons like no funds or invalid input. Or if we do need it we should interrogate code only for particular types.
Initially the refuse stream also occurred on createTopic, so a retry on topic creation was valid where a new topic is needed - which is most tests.
Ok, so just need to check for UNAVAILABLE here then

I don't think you can retry a batch, right? You might've sent one successfully then got an exception on second. It would then try to send the first one again. Retry should be on the single publish message if at all.
Makes sense to retry a single emit. I'll update that

Overloaded method to retry single attempt to publishes messages not a batch.
As part of a larger refactor I'd have moved this into TopicClient but I'm hitting some issues and this works for now.
3rd param is numBatches so why is a message timeout being passed?

I believe the recommendation was yours to emit a message every second for as long as we are listening for messages.
Therefore a 20 sec max timeout would mean emit at worst a message every seconds 20 times.
That's the logic here.

Yeah, just confusing to have a numBatches be populated by a timeout. Would be better to use a ScheduledExecutorService in the future to run until the timeout:
Executors.newSingleThreadScheduledExecutor().scheduleAtFixedRate(() -> {}, 0, 1, TimeUnit.SECONDS).get(timeout, TimeUnit.Seconds);

This is all  quite tightly coupled together. A feature should not know about threads, retrying or background production of messages. Would be better if topicClient handled it internally via one of its existing methods. Could be done in follow up
Yep agreed. This was part of the stuff I mentioned could be refactored but could wait.
Ah missed this. Thanks
These two methods now seem to be unused
Removed
subscribeRetryBackoffPeriod and should be Duration. and not null
Will fix
I thought it was implied, but will state explicitly: exceptionExpression should be populated on all retryables
I got it, just forgot these 2 and hand't pushed it yet.
